ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I improved my skills at field identification of invertebrate species, I learned good practices for animal dissection, and I studied anatomy of many different organisms.

I learned how to use a microscope to look at an organism in detail and identify different anatomical parts. I learned how to be more observative in order to understand how the body parts of an organism function and compare to other organisms.
Anatomy of almost all clades of animals

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I loved the lab notebook format of the course. Because we didn't have to worry about writing lab reports, and we just had to write and draw observations as we followed the lab procedure, the class was very low stress. The course was also very independent - we were given a list of tasks to complete for each lab, and the order we completed them in was completely up to us. Casey was also very flexible about lab tasks. We were pretty much able to study or examine any specimen in lab however we wanted to, so long as we kept busy! I do think the quizzes were a weak point of the course - they were really difficult to study for, and always seemed to cover random material.

Professor Dunn is extremely passionate and willing to talk about/explain anything. This is a lab class where you can feel free to explore and have fun. The hardest part of the course was the evaluations and you really need to study in order to do well! I spent a lot of time memorizing. The TA, Namrata, was very helpful and approachable.

The only weakness of the course might be that sometimes it was difficult to dissect organisms because of the lack of diagrams in some instructions, but that is more so a limitation of the information available to us

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would! It felt like a really relaxing, enriching experience.
Yes, you will have access to an amazing collection of species from all over the phylogenetic tree. This is a class where you can explore, draw, observe. Just be ready to study for the lab quizzes.

Definitely, especially if you are taking it with the lecture--I can't imagine not having taken the lab because of how helpful it was for learning anatomy (and some behavior) of organisms we were learning about in class.
